reviewText:
Although in this movie you get both Montalbanos, Tony Servillo and Luigi Lo Cascio, you're not going to get much else unless you have boned up on your Italian history from the days of the Carbonari past  the "invasion" of the Kingdom of Naples by the Piedmontese.setting the scene for the Southern Question that remains a important part of Italian political and economic discussions.  Resorgimento?  Foreign War?  The Kingdom of the two Sicilies /later Kingdom of Naples was an independent state.  Arguments continue.

The movie is magnificent, indeed, especially in the depiction of Cristina Trivulzio di Belgiojoso, one of the heroines of unification, who deserves a movie all on her own.  .

.
A splendid copy of a splendid movie.
